it.dc.bridge.om

Interface CoAPRequestMessage

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RequestMessage

    public interface CoAPRequestMessage
    The CoAP request message interface. The class that represents a request message implements this interface and all methods it contains.

    The following methods are implemented:

    • getOptions() get the option fields
    • setOptions(Options) set the option fields
    • getAttributes() get the query attributes
    • setAttributes(Map) set the query attributes
    • getPayload() get the message payload
    • getPayloadString() get the message payload as a string
    • setPayload(byte[]) set the message payload from raw data
    • setPayload(String) set the message payload from a string
    See Also:
    CoAPResponseMessage

      • getAttributes

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAttributes()
        The query attributes are used to perform query filtering. The query serves to further parameterize the resource. It consists in a sequence of arguments in the form of a ”key=value” pair.

        An AllJoyn application specifies zero or more query options, the Bridge composes the URI from them, and then it sends the message to the CoAP Server.

        This method get the query attributes of a request message.

        Returns:
        a dictionary of key-value pairs

      • setAttributes

        void setAttributes(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attributes)
        Sets the query attributes of a requet message.
        Parameters:
        attributes - dictionary of key-value pairs

      • getPayload

        byte[] getPayload()
        Gets the raw payload.
        Returns:

      • getPayloadString

        java.lang.String getPayloadString()
        Gets the payload in the form of a string. Returns an empty string if no payload is defined.
        Returns:
        the payload as string

      • setPayload

        void setPayload(byte[] payload)
        Sets the payload from raw data.
        Parameters:

      • setPayload

        void setPayload(java.lang.String payload)
        Sets the UTF-8 bytes from the specified string as payload.
        Parameters:
        payload - the payload as sting
